jcr:content.jcr:description: Frankfurt/Main, XX. June 2015 – Worldline [Euronext: WLN], the European leader in payment and transactional services, and Commerzbank extend their existing processing contract for seven years. Since 1998 Commerzbank handles credit card payments via the technical platform of Worldline to process credit card transactions efficiently and secure.
jcr:content.jcr:title: Commerzbank counts another seven years on Worldline

richtext.text:
Frankfurt/Main, XX. June 2015 – Worldline [Euronext: WLN], the European leader in payment and transactional services, and Commerzbank extend their existing processing contract for seven years. Since 1998 Commerzbank handles credit card payments via the technical platform of Worldline to process credit card transactions efficiently and secure.

Worldline carries out the "Full Processing" for Commerzbank. That includes the complete technical processing for all Visa Cards and MasterCards of the bank. The portfolio consists of Commerzbank credit cards as well as co-branded cards that are issued together with partners. Components of the contract are the technical processing as well as services for customers

"We continue our cooperation because Worldline can support us with reliable service, high security and low costs”, says Julian Mattes, Head of Payments and Deposits at Commerzbank. “The long-term partnership offers us the possibility to jointly implement future-oriented offers. We are looking forward to the further good cooperation. "
Wolf Kunisch, Managing Director of Worldline for Financial Processing & Software Licensing and responsible for Worldline Germany & CEE, explains: " Worldline is operating with Commerzbank for many years very successfully and particularly based on partnership. That’s the reason why we have already managed big migrations and system changeovers together. This also includes among others the big project of the portfolio consolidation of Commerzbank and Dresdner Bank in 2009. The current extension of the contract shows that our services meet the latest standards of safety, quality and regulatory requirements."

About Worldline

Worldline [Euronext: WLN] is the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. Worldline delivers new-generation services, enabling its customers to offer smooth and innovative solutions to the end consumer. Key actor for B2B2C industries, with over 40 years of experience, Worldline supports and contributes to the success of all businesses and administrative services in a perpetually evolving market. Worldline offers a unique and flexible business model built around a global and growing portfolio, thus enabling end-to-end support. Worldline activities are organized around three axes: Merchant Services & Terminals, Mobility & e-Transactional Services, Financial Processing & Software Licensing. Worldline employs more than 7,300 people worldwide and generated 1.15 billion euros revenues in 2014. Worldline is an Atos company. worldline.com
